text: <@U0KPFAZNF> you might want to add cr-fabric to <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1599/>
so, TL;DR: I caught up to yesterday but then saw things start to fall apart
I think we need to pursue the multiple repos gradually
some could be fresh start as Gari suggests, and others can be decomposition/refactoring of the current entangled package structure (I am already hitting this big time with the Go SDK/CLI
we need protos on its own with no external dependencies from other modules
currently there are some dependencies with some stuff in peer/common and core/comm and so forth
then, we refactor the dependent components to pull in the fabric-protos package as external dependency
lather, rinse repeat - gradually build up to where we need to get (<@U1AU8DRQR>’s #2 which <@U11MANG9G> supported and I certainly support)
one big commit will be almost impossible
could be that every new repo just starts as <@U0UHG4VP1> suggested as a copy of master and deletes stuff that isn’t necessary
we do need a solid proposal that organizes what goes where
to avoid the circular import problem
so, who is working on the proposal?
